editorialSummary.text: Cozy, no-frills rooms & suites (some with river views), plus free WiFi & an on-site cafe/teahouse.

originalText.text: The room (bunk twin for 2) was a bit cramped but good for the price. Our room had no fridge. The view and location are great! The staff was friendly. One thing to note is the bathroom wall is frosted glass and somewhat see-through, so make sure you’re comfortable with the person you’re rooming with.

Had an awesome time here. Very convenient location about two blocks away from the closest subway station. Very friendly, helpful staff - especially Juan (hope that's how you spell it). As I arrived here NYE, Juan gave me some helpful advice on what to do here in NYC.

Would happily stay here again. Small but cozy room. Might struggle to fit in luggage if two people

The only reason for the 4/5 for rooms, is that it is under renovation.

originalText.text:
Would rate it 2.5/5.

I knew the hotel was still under renovation and that there would be quirks. Reading the other reviews I was aware of the single elevator that can get busy at peak times, etc and that was all fine.

In terms of positives, the price we paid for NYC is unbeatable but that’s because there are a lot of quirks. The rooms are clean and well renovated. I think the hotel rooms are great for couples or a max of two people. We were a group of three and there was some awkwardness (mainly around the bathrooms). The area is also in a great part of the city. The hotel staff are also very pleasant but considering most issues are not their expertise, they can only really apologize for the inconvenience.

As for the negatives:
- The building had hot water issues for our whole trip. We would only have hot water for two hours at a time, and it would be over a weird schedule that would change. Ex. On from 6:30-8:30AM, then off till 10:30AM. This was never conveyed to us upon check-in and we had to find out after trying to take a shower later our first night.
- The bathrooms were awkward in our room. The only separation is a sliding glass door that is fairly see-through and the first bed faced directly at the bathroom door. There’s a large bathroom fan in the roof that doesn’t seem to turn on/work. Make sure you’re very comfortable with who you’re traveling with cause you’re going to see and hear everything people are doing in the bathroom.
- TVs were attached to a Chromecast that only sometimes worked. We couldn’t cast on both TVs at the same time in the two rooms as it appears they aren’t setup properly.
-The room was only cleaned once for our 4 day stay. They mentioned rooms are only cleaned for longer stays but our rooms were never cleaned on the specified day and we had to inquire with the front desk and request a cleaning, get clean towels, etc.

As others mentioned it’s a decent option when only needing a place to sleep. Once they get through the growing pains of the renovation, it could be a good option for a single person or couples traveling. That said, even at a discount, I don’t think our experience matched the $250/night it cost us.

originalText.text:
We had a lot of problems during our stay for 9 nights. We always discussed this with the staff, who were all really nice, but the problems were not fixed.

The AC didn’t work, being colder in the room than outside. Most days during our stay we just had warm water and the last two days we had to take cold showers because there was not hot water. The bathroom shower was always flooded and smelled really bad for a renovated hotel. No toilet brush provided. Not many towels provided as well.
The cleaning was really bad and is only made after 3 nights in the hotel. We were never able to connect with the TV and they never cared to help us so we were never able to watch TV (would not count with this service).

Also, there’s a metro station close to the hotel but it’s closed on weekends. The closest one is a 10/15 min walk.

As they are under renovations there’s only one elevator working.

They did not take full responsibility for everything that went wrong and keep ignoring our emails.

Although they are under renovations and their rate is lower than other hotels is still crucial to provide minimum services as hot water, a warm room and proper cleaning, when running an hotel. I would not recommend you to stay here if these are important things for you. Definitely would pay more for a better place than being back here.

originalText.text:
Incredible value for that price. The rooms are new and clean, they have a big TV with Google Chromecast and the river side rooms have amazing views. Everyone at the reception was really friendly and they helped us whenever we needed.

*The hotel is currently in renovation so only one elevator works out of the two (it will probably be ready at the end of this year).

Pros:
-Cheap
-Close to subway
-Really clean

Cons:
-It might take some time to catch the elevator if it’s pretty busy (will be solved once the other elevator will be opened)
-The shower head is wall mounted
-The car noise outside can be pretty disturbing for some during the night

Observations:
-I don’t know if this applies to every room, but we didn’t get a toilet scrubber
-The AC randomly turned on once during the night

Overall really really good hotel, will definitely return.
